name: Vegan Tofu Katsu Curry
description: Curb your Japanese take-out cravings with this easy homemade vegan tofu katsu curry recipe! Crispy panko breaded tofu in a creamy mildly spiced curry sauce. Nutfree, GF option soyfree option
recipeIngredient: 14 oz Extra firm tofu  (pressed between paper towels for 15 minutes and then sliced)
15 oz can of full-fat coconut milk
1.5 tbsp of all purpose flour (for Glutenfree use 2 tsp rice flour and 1 tbsp corn starch)
1 tsp soy sauce (, tamari for gf, coconut aminos for soyfree)
1 cup Panko bread crumbs (( or other breadcrumbs. If they’re too large then crush them a little before using))
pickled vegetables (Such as carrots, radish and cucumber)
cooked rice, scallions, asian chili sauce such as sambal oelek

recipeInstructions.text: Prep – Press the tofu if you have not already and then slice and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep – Press the tofu if you have not already and then slice and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the sauce while you press the tofu: Heat a saucepan over medium heat and combine all of the curry sauce ingredients, whisk well to combine and bring to a good boil, stirring occasionally , and simmer for a minute. Take off the heat and let it cool for a minute, so that it thickens.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the sauce while you press the tofu: Heat a saucepan over medium heat and combine all of the curry sauce ingredients, whisk well to combine and bring to a good boil, stirring occasionally , and simmer for a minute. Take off the heat and let it cool for a minute, so that it thickens.

recipeInstructions.text: Dip the pressed and dry-blotted tofu slices into the curry sauce. You can also let them marinate in the fridge for an hour for more flavor.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip the pressed and dry-blotted tofu slices into the curry sauce. You can also let them marinate in the fridge for an hour for more flavor.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your breading by mixing the bread crumbs, salt, and cayenne in a shallow bowl. Now, take the tofu slices out of the marinade, and let the excess curry sauce drip off. Now place the tofu into the shallow bowl to coat with breading from all sides. Repeat for all slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare your breading by mixing the bread crumbs, salt, and cayenne in a shallow bowl. Now, take the tofu slices out of the marinade, and let the excess curry sauce drip off. Now place the tofu into the shallow bowl to coat with breading from all sides. Repeat for all slices.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat, once hot drizzle a grilling pan with a little bit of oil. Place the breaded tofu slices on the grill pan. Press each slice a little bit for a few seconds at a time. Cook for 3-5 minutes until grill marks are formed. Take off the grill pan and set aside. You can also pan fry these breaded tofu in a shallow pan/cast iron skillet.

Press each slice a little bit for a few seconds at a time. Cook for 3-5 minutes until grill marks are formed. Take off the grill pan and set aside. You can also pan fry these breaded tofu in a shallow pan/cast iron skillet.

recipeInstructions.text: To serve, fill the bowl with rice, pickled vegetables, some blanched veggies like bok choy or broccoli. Slice the breaded tofu slices diagonally and place on top of each of the bowls, drizzle with the remaining curry sauce liberally and serve. Add a dollop of asian Chile sauce in side for heat if needed.
